meanings.definition: A substance that makes something impure or unsuitable for use.
meanings.sent1: The oil spill in the ocean was a contaminant that harmed the marine life.
meanings.sent2: The factory released contaminants into the river, polluting the water.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined when a contaminant got into the potato salad.
meanings.sent4: His negative attitude was like a contaminant spreading through the team.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the contaminant turned the clear water murky and unsafe to drink.

meanings.definition: To make something impure by exposure to or addition of a contaminant.
meanings.sent1: Careless waste disposal can easily contaminate the environment with a contaminant.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally contaminated the experiment by introducing a foreign contaminant.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon seemed to enjoy contaminating the garden with its paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The gossip quickly contaminated the peaceful atmosphere of the office.
meanings.sent5: The chef took great care to ensure no contaminant would spoil the fresh ingredients.
